topic.title: Read Flash Command

body.p: The Read Flash Command is used to read data from Flash.

section.title: MRPC Read Flash Command Input Data

table.title: MRPC Read Flash Command Input Data

section.p: The start address to be read from Flash. Should be un-cached Flash address, for example: 0xa8000000.
Byte count to be read from Flash.

note.p: 2. Please make sure the area specified by Start Address and Length is in Flash Space.

section.title: MRPC Read Flash Command Output Data

table.title: MRPC Read Flash Command Output Data

section.p: The value read from Flash. The pad value is 0xFF.
For example, if start address is 0xA8000000, the length is 0x1, and the byte value is 0x55 in the offset 0xA8000000, the output Data 0 will be 0xFFFFFF55.

section.title: Example
section.p: This example issues GAS commands via the ChipLink CLI to read the Configuration File version field and CRC. This example can be extended using host in-band access as well.
Steps to read Configuration File version from MRPC Read Flash command

strow.stentry: Determine the address range of the configuration or firmware address for your platform.
In the output above (from fw_part CLI command) identify the end addresses of the image you want to pull CRC/Version information out (bolded).
CRC Information is located at address (n + 1) - 4, where n is the end address identified above
For this example, the CRC information for DAT0 is located at 0xa821fffc.
Version Information is located at address (n + 1) - 16, where n is the end address identified above
For this example, the Version information for DAT0 is located at 0xa821fff0.
gaswr 0x0 0xa821fffc
psxapp barregwr 0x0 0x4 0xa821fffc
This sets the address for the MRPC command to read the CRC info for DAT0.
gaswr 0x4 0x4
psxapp barregwr 0x4 0x4 0x4
This sets the length field to 4 bytes (use 0x2 for the version field).
gaswr 0x800 0x1001F
psxapp barregwr 0x800 0x4 0x1001F
This instructs the MRPC to issue the READ_FLASH command with no indication to the management host.
gasrd 0x804 0x1
psxapp barregrd 0x804 0x1
Check the MRPC status and confirm if it is 0x2 (command completed).
gasrd 0x400 0x1
psxapp barregrd 0x400 0x1
